date: 
2017-09-19
                

 référence: 28301-fr_ca


type de poste : permanent 
lieu principal : montréal, québec, canada 
emplacements additionnels : montréal 
poste le conseiller principal microsoft business intelligence est responsable de concevoir et de fournir des applications de veille stratégique performantes à nos clients en dirigeant une équipe de conseillers avec le directeur de projet. le candidat idéal est un architecte microsoft chevronné qui se passionne pour les nouvelles technologies et la gestion du rendement, et qui est toujours prêt à interagir directement avec les clients.
responsabilités

diriger les validations de principe à l’aide des technologies appropriées de microsoft business intelligence.
diriger les étapes d’analyse, de conception, de développement et de mise à l’essai.
documenter les processus d’affaires et les exigences d’affaires et du système.
fournir les spécifications liées à l’outil etl ou aux flux de données axés sur les services.
établir et mettre en œuvre la stratégie infonuagique microsoft business intelligence.
diriger la conception de la base de données pour les solutions suivantes : entrepôt de données, centre de données, lac de données, gestion des données de base et données massives.
soutenir les tests et les essais d’acceptation par l’utilisateur intégrés.
orienter le réglage de la performance.
agir à titre de leader sur place pour le centre de développement canadien.
soutenir le directeur de projet et le chef de mêlée.
définir des pratiques et une méthodologie de développement efficaces pour l’équipe.
guider les développeurs tout au long des étapes de développement.
déployer des solutions liées à la méthode devops du client.
participer à l’élaboration de propositions de projet et de demandes d’information.

participer aux activités de développement des affaires.
qualificationscompétences

un minimum de 10 ans d'expérience pertinente.
titulaire d’un baccalauréat.
solide expérience de travail dans un environnement lié à microsoft business intelligence (ssis, ssas, ssrs, power bi).
trois ans d’expérience au moins en exécution de divers projets concernant les technologies microsoft azure.
expérience liée à la méthodologie agile.
expérience éprouvée en conception et en développement à titre d’architecte ou de conseiller principal microsoft business intelligence dans des environnements complexes.
expérience de travail en ce qui a trait au dépannage des problèmes liés aux requêtes, aux rapports, aux cubes ou aux tableaux de bord dans microsoft business intelligence.
expérience en développement à l’aide d’outils de contrôle des versions, par exemple tfs.
connaissances de ms project, des plateformes agile et de visio.
bonnes aptitudes pour la communication écrite et orale, en français et en anglais.
expérience éprouvée en exécution d’analyses des écarts et des incidences.
expérience en soutien des utilisateurs d’affaires travaillant sur des projets ou programmes comprenant de nombreuses applications ou sources de données fortement interdépendantes.         
capacité éprouvée de collaboration avec des organisations clientes.
aptitude à travailler avec des équipes diversifiées à distance et à les diriger.
expérience en gestion du changement.

démarrez votre carrière en beauté. quelle influence aurez-vous?
nous sommes toujours à la recherche de personnes qui ont l’énergie et la motivation nécessaires pour se dépasser et pour trouver de nouvelles manières d’atteindre nos objectifs communs. chez deloitte, nous savons que pour être le chef de file incontesté, nous devons permettre à nos gens d’atteindre leur plein potentiel afin qu’ils aient une influence marquante sur les clients, les collègues et la collectivité de même que sur leur propre carrière.
 
nous offrons une expérience réellement distinctive en matière de talent qui permet à nos gens d’accomplir un travail valorisant; nous leur offrons aussi des occasions de croissance, d’apprentissage et de leadership où qu’ils en soient dans leur carrière. les nouveaux bureaux de deloitte offrent un espace de travail unique qui renforce les liens entre nos gens, leur inspire de nouvelles façons de travailler et leur fournit les outils nécessaires pour avoir une influence marquante. et grâce à notre portée et à notre réseau mondiaux, vous ferez toujours partie de la communauté de deloitte.
 
« deloitte un jour, deloitte toujours. »
 
prenez les rênes de votre vie. prenez les rênes d’une équipe. prenez les rênes du cabinet. toutes ces possibilités s’offrent à vous chez deloitte.

deloitte, l’un des cabinets de services professionnels les plus importants au canada, offre des services dans les domaines de l’audit, de la fiscalité, de la consultation et des conseils financiers dans l’ensemble du canada. chez deloitte, nous jumelons notre connaissance du secteur à une profonde compréhension des enjeux d’affaires locaux et mondiaux actuels afin de fournir à nos clients des solutions judicieuses, pratiques et fondées sur les principes dont ils ont besoin pour résoudre les problèmes d’aujourd’hui et de demain. 
 
 
laissez deloitte vous montrer comment progresser dans votre cheminement. et donnez vie à votre histoire.
 
deloitte est un employeur inclusif qui s’est engagé à créer une main-d’œuvre diversifiée. nous invitons tous les candidats qualifiés à postuler et nous effectuerons les aménagements nécessaires afin de répondre à leurs besoins, conformément aux codes provinciaux des droits de la personne, à toutes les étapes du processus de recrutement et de sélection. veuillez aviser le recruteur pour vous assurer que vos besoins en matière d’accessibilité sont respectés tout au long du processus. les renseignements reçus relativement aux aménagements seront traités de façon confidentielle.
 
nous remercions tous les candidats qui manifesteront leur intérêt, mais nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue.

homecareerswork @ utopia imagebusiness intelligence analyst
















business intelligence analyst







the customer experience management team has three key mandates in support of utopia image’s mission: data collection, business intelligence and offering strategic advice.  in summary, our responsibilities consist in conducting telephone follow-ups for customer experience and customer satisfaction campaigns from our clients, which allows us to provide them with constructive feedback on their own customers’ opinion and perceptions of the employee’s know-how. this insight enables our clients to identify the required action plans to improve the delivery (processes) and execution (behaviour) in servicing their clientele. when required, we assist them in the development and implementation of these changes and initiatives.  under the responsibility of the vice president, customer experience management, the business intelligence analyst will be responsible for analyzing raw data responses for various campaigns. he/she will identify and communicate best practices and opportunities for improvement towards operational processes – which will in turn promote customer retention. he/she must understand our clients’ reality, objectives, priorities and comments while synthesizing all the data gathered to prepare insightful opportunistic reports.



responsibilities 

work with internal and external stakeholders as well as it partners to develop and analyze business intelligence requirements;work with our customers and it teams to transform data in critical information that empowers our customers to make sound business decisions; analyze data gathered from various platforms for internal and client’s requests;transform data into actionable insights and present findings to internal partners and clients;look for business problems and create models that help predict and analyze these situations;develop and deliver training materials, provide support and offer training for end users for our bi dashboards and reporting tools; review competitive data and industry trends to determine where the firm is in the marketplace, where it can improve, increase its operational efficiency, and how it can stand out from the competition with its customer experience delivery;develop policies and procedures for data collection and analysis;monitor analysis and measurements results;review client files to ensure the integrity of data collection and usage;perform data profiling.



training and experience 

bachelor's degree in business administration, information systems or mathematics with a data science program or equivalent;two to three years of relevant professional experience in a bi or data analyst position with practical experience in complex data analysis;ability to understand and find appropriate solutions to data and analysis results;ability to translate complex data into reports or visuals such as charts, dashboards, and report tracking tools that can be used by a variety of audiences; anticipate, identify and define problems;investigate root causes and implement practical and relevant solutions;ability to work independently or in a team and to meet predetermined deadlines;exceptional data manipulation skills using digital computing, graphing, data analysis (including pivottables) and excel software programming;outstanding presentation skills (powerpoint), the ability to effectively and clearly communicate data, analysis and results to all stakeholders;knowledge of sql and database systems (oracle, sql server, teradata) an asset;experience with technologies/approaches to extraction, transformation and data loading (etl) an asset.



requirements 

excellent technical and analytical skills;excellent communication skills (dissemination of information);problem solver;good priority management skills and sense of initiative;fluency in french and english, both oral and written.

the provincial health services authority (phsa) plans, manages and evaluates selected specialty and province-wide health care services across bc, working with the five geographic health authorities to deliver province-wide solutions that improve the health of british columbians. phsa embodies values that reflect a commitment to excellence. these include: patients first • respect people • be compassionate • dare to innovate • cultivate partnerships • serve with purpose.hr business intelligence analystjob requisition #62935burnaby, bcreporting to the hris manager, the primary focus for the business intelligence (bi) analyst is to develop and maintain “extract transform load” (etl) solutions for hr related data sources. the analyst works closely with bi team lead and other hris specialists to audit identify and follow-up on issues related to data quality, metric definitions or process deficiencies. responsibilities also include database development and monitoring, data modeling, data dictionary development and maintenance, ad-hoc reporting, report development, documentation, maintenance of users and user permissions. analyst is responsible for problem identification and documentation with respect to data stored in hris databases. this position is also responsible for support and liaison with technology services for hardware and network problems as it relates to hris data warehouse and bi environments.the role requires excellent analytical skills and ability to turn complex business requirements into analysis ready data-sets, data-marts, cubes or data-models. although the primary communication is with hr analysts and hris specialists, the role communicates with hr staff at all levels to ensure their requirements are met. having access to private and sensitive data, this role requires the knowledge of privacy and confidentiality policies and procedures.key accountabilitiesdesigns, develops and maintains hris databases, etl, olap cubes, reports, dashboards and other bi content as required.works collaboratively with clients and business analysts to gather requirements, create definitions and specifications and translate those into data models, etl packages and reports as appropriate.administers the sql server databases (hr data marts) including security, user permissions, performance and usage monitoring.maintains data quality and ensures data integrity and daily refresh of hris data warehouse and olap cubes and bi content.maintains lookup tables, writes technical and user documentation, troubleshoots issues with reports, data sources, performance and other related dutieswrites ad-hoc queries and reports to support hr analysts and leaders in data analysis.creates and maintains report subscriptions for hr staff and operational leaders across participating organizations.provides first line support to users for all hris published bi content.provides technical and educational support to hris specialists and hr analysts and report writers.maintains the hris reporting environment (sql ssrs, tableau, sharepoint team site)collaborates with the tech services, vendors and other teams on hardware and software implementation, upgrades and troubleshooting as it relates to hris database and bi software and hardware.communicates with external clients such as heabc, ministry of health, wsbc etc. on definitions, ad-hoc queries and regular data/report submissions as directed by hr stakeholders.ensures that hris databases, reports and other bi content are developed and maintained in accordance with phsa privacy and confidentiality guidelines.evaluates the current solutions, researches new and alternative technologies, processes and approaches according to industry best practices.qualificationsa level of education, training, and experience equivalent to degree or diploma in information systems or computer science from a recognized school, plus a minimum of three (3) years recent related work experience preferably in a healthcare environment. development experience with the ms sharepoint bi toolset required.an in-depth working knowledge of relational and multidimensional (olap) databases as well as a proven knowledge and experience in working with sql server bi stack. administrative experience including setting up new users, monitoring performance, and query tuning.ability and experience to develop technical documentation. ability to understand management reporting and statistical concepts. demonstrated ability to analyze operational problems and recommend innovative solutions. ability to work in teams on projects with little or no supervision. self-directed and motivated to learn new technology including hardware, software applications, and programming applications. ability to organize workload, set priorities and meet deadlines in a dynamic environment. ability and flexibility to multi-task. ability to communicate effectively in english both verbally and in writing. ability to quickly adapt to new technology. physical ability to perform the duties of the job.we invite you to apply by clicking the "apply online now" button where you can register for the first time or enter your username and password in order to re-access your profile on our system.resumes will be accepted until the position is filled.for more information about phsa please visit the website at: www.phsa.cathe phsa is committed to employment equity and hires on the basis of merit. we encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities.

date: 
sep 14, 2017
                


location: 
mississauga, on, ca


company: 
bell


simply put, customers, innovation, and success are at the heart of what we do at the source and why we do it.  these three words shape our business decisions and our everyday actions.  they are the foundation of our commitment to being a great place to work and becoming the customers’ consumer electronics and communication store of choice! join us and discover a career that is challenging and rewarding.
 
who you’ll work with
at the source we offer expert training and further opportunities for professional growth and development. we are looking for professionals who are passionate, driven to learn and make a difference in an industry that is continuously changing! be the leader you’ve always wanted to be—in a fun, fast-paced and competitive industry. 
 
we're all working toward one goal: supporting our sales team in creating a shopping experience that will keep our customers coming back. sound like a team you want to be a part of? our talent acquisition team can't wait to meet you!

are you passionate about the customer experience and have the drive to ensure that the design and execution of our sales strategy is successful?
do you thrive in a fast paced environment?
are you an effective, confident communicator that knows the right questions to ask to get the job done?
do you want to be a key player in evolving the long term sales strategy at the source?

 
if you answered yes to these questions this is an excellent opportunity to work in a high profile, challenging environment!
 
the business intelligence analyst is a key member of the source’s retail execution team.  the team plays an integral role in the design and execution of weekly, quarterly and yearly sales plans for the source.
 
reporting to the senior manager, retail insights & sales planning, the candidate will have the opportunity to influence the daily sales operations and steer the long-term sales growth strategy at the source by providing analytical insights to optimize sales productivity in a multi-unit environment totalizing more than 450 stores nationally. 
 
the candidate will work closely with all levels of sales management and will interact with key business partners from merchandising, marketing, finance, product, business intelligence, and as well, groups within bell mobility and bell residential services.
 
responsibilities

complete regular sales volume planning and sales target setting
support inventory planning and analysis for the wireless business
provide ad-hoc analysis and recommendations to support performance management activities
support quarterly sales plan design
provide  regular recommendations to the sales and the marketing leadership team to support and influence their decision making when developing new strategies to grow the business
work with business partners to gather, validate and document business requirements to develop sales kpi reporting

 
required skills

proven ability to gather and manipulate a large sets of data coming from numerous sources and systems
proven data analytical ability with a focus on detail, accuracy, complex problem solving and logic capabilities
proficient in advanced ms powerpoint functions and ms excel functions such as pivot tables, v-lookup functions, ms access and general data manipulation
excellent understanding of the telecommunications industry
ability to multi-task and understand competing priorities following through to the completion of assigned projects
excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to clearly and convincingly communicate and influence both in written and oral

 
preferred qualifications

university/college degree in business
preferred to have wireless industry or retail operations experience
2-3 years of experience in a similar job function
ability to speak french is an asset.

position type: corporate careers
position: analyst, business intelligence - the source 
job location: canada : ontario : mississauga  
application deadline: 10/09/2017 
 
it’s all about you
we're proud to offer a competitive compensation package including an extensive recognition and rewards program, career advancement opportunities, awesome training programs, competitive medical and dental benefits, charity and volunteer opportunities and of course, associate discounts!
the source celebrates and embraces diversity as part of our company culture. we strive to be an inclusive, equitable and accessible environment that supports both our internal and external customers, ensuring everyone feels valued and respected.

business intelligence analyst

bookmark this posting |
    print preview |
        apply for this job



posting details



position information



job title
business intelligence analyst


hours per week/fte
35


responsibilities
the glass is never half full or half empty, instead it is twice as big as it needs to be. if you find this statement logical, please keep reading. institutional planning, analysis and risk services is looking for a creative yet analytical thinker to join our team.  the ideal person will have the ability to build universes, mine data, create analytical reports, present complex statistics and turn information into actionable intelligence.  the primary function of the business intelligence analyst position is to make evidence based decisions easy at lethbridge college.
the incumbent will be responsible for the overall coordination of the college’s business intelligence (bi) systems to reflect organizational need and to provide bi support for the development of relevant planning documents, models and dashboards.  this requires the ability to design, develop and maintain these materials to effectively utilize bi support for measuring and evaluating strategic outcomes, and performance metrics.
this position is also responsible for providing assistance for applicable accountability reporting and associated functions to alberta advanced education.


job duties
specific job duties include:
•	provide bi support for the development and maintenance of highly complex reports, institutional dashboards, performance metrics, and planning models such as enrolment planning, tuition and program health.
•	overall coordination of the bi systems including a shared responsibility with it services for system design, development, upgrades and ongoing maintenance and user security maintenance and protection of institutional data integrity.
•	contribute to the preparation of accountability reporting to advanced education where applicable.
•	provide expertise and strategic insight into the development of institutional performance measures and reporting standards.
•	provide bi training, education and awareness to designated power users.


required qualifications
post-secondary education with a degree in a related field including economics, business, computer science or statistics or formal certification in business intelligence;
2-5 years of related experience in information technology and preferably a bi environment including reporting and analytics;
strong proficiency with excel and programming knowledge;
experience working with large data sets and a deep knowledge of bi principles, practices and methodologies;
experience with sap business objects, ellucian colleague considered a strong asset;
results driven team player with strong analytical and computer skills with the ability to anticipate end user needs.


preferred qualifications



salary
starting at $72,414 - $85,194; commensurate with education and experience.

p17-00091

title: Director of Strategy
text:
working at the beer store | the beer store



















skip to main content






click here for beer xpress update









the beer store









the beer store


menu

our beerswhat's on salenew productsthe top ten brandsordering kegshome draught unitsstore locatorfor the love of beerbeer 101food & beer pairingsparty planninggift cardsabout uscareersenvironmental leadershipsocial responsibilitycommunity involvementbusiness serviceslicenseesdraught servicesretail partnersownership & governanceownership










new search


director of strategy


division:
executive


department:
finance executive


location:
mississauga corporate office


employment status:
permanent


position type:
full time


physical job requirements:
desk job


apply by:




description
we have a full time permanent opportunity at the beer store mississauga corporate office for a director of strategy.
this role will be leading the identification and development of strategic opportunities and initiatives to achieve long and short term objectives, supervising the execution of the company's long range strategic plan, providing analytical and execution support for strategic projects/issues and overseeing business transformation initiatives.
 
why join the beer store? 
we have a flexible and accommodating workplace, promoting work life balance. we are socially and environmentally responsible and have been green before green was cool! there are opportunities for professional growth and development within our organization and a genuine, friendly corporate culture. you’ll enjoy participation in our total rewards program which includes benefits the first day in your role, a competitive base salary, incentive plans, annual merit review, health, dental and pension benefits. apply now and find out more about our team!
 
key accountabilities: 


direct strategic planning for assigned enterprise initiatives, as well as for designated departments and business lines; identifies opportunities for business and service line expansion, complete with feasibility studies and risk analysis in collaboration with operating leaders


direct responsibility for and management of the project management office (pmo) in support of business transformation initiatives


partner with company leaders, outside organizations and stakeholders to manage the development and implementation of projects that support the company’s strategic objectives


identify risks to and opportunities from strategic initiatives and seeks to optimise the achievement of the long range plan.


identify threats both inside and outside the company that would impede continued success or opportunities to grow the business and increase market share; prepare competitive analysis for the purposes of performance benchmarking vs competitors and other industries for best practices.


evaluate new business models, strategic opportunities/partnerships, and internal operational plans through data-driven analysis and execution


develop and generate strategic recommendations through independent analysis of provincial regulations, governmental affairs and business environment


monitor of company and market performance to determine if strategies need to be adjusted and/or new strategies developed


maintain diverse knowledge of industry trends, regulatory compliance, competitive intelligence and market research with the ability to integrate the information into actionable strategic and long-range plans


provide analytical support for special projects as directed by the president/board
 
 


the ideal applicant will have: 


university degree in business, finance, strategy or a related area


a minimum of 8 -10 years’ broad business experience with strategy focused business projects


experience in leading cross functional teams and interacting in a cross-functional environment with senior management


demonstrated experience in relationship management, large-scale strategy development, transformation and project management


pmp/lean six sigma certification, change management experience would be an asset


excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams


demonstrated leadership ability, and the ability to challenge the expected and drive innovative thinking throughout the organization


strong decision-making, collaboration, conflict resolution and partnering skills


proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving
 


 
**please apply with your resume to this posting if interested. hiring date is asap***
 
we are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the ontario human rights code and the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act. if contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise human resources if you require accommodation.
** thank you for your interest in this role. only applicants that have been selected for an interview will be contacted. thank you. **

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
text: business intelligence analyst job - absorb software inc. - calgary, ab | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobsfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province business intelligence analyst absorb software inc. - calgary, ab the position: the business intelligence analyst is responsible to empower absorb software’s management team to leverage high quality information, allowing for insightful decisions. the bi analyst provides consulting services to the leaders of the various business units to develop pertinent metrics and kpi’s distributed via centralized, and on demand, reports and dashboards. the main responsibilities also include contributing to the enhancement of the existing business intelligence infrastructure and processes. the candidate must be a critical thinker, known for their problem resolution skills, be a strong team player, self-motivated, and have good communication skills.the company: absorb software started out 14 years ago as a small e-learning company and has grown into a global player in the learning management system (lms) industry. if you've never heard of an lms before, don't worry, most of us hadn't either. you've probably used one though; maybe for a safety course or some corporate hr policy video. now imagine one of those that doesn't suck, and you have our flagship product, absorb lms . we provide our lms to big name clients like uber, airbnb, a&w, johnson & johnson, and lots of others with strange acronyms that you've never heard of. but enough about the lms, let's talk about us! our careers page should give you a pretty good idea of what to expect here: a fun, open and modern environment that is about as far from "corporate" as you can get. we believe that creating an awesome workplace is the best way to ensure that we deliver great service to our clients. if this sounds like the kind of place you want to work, send us your resume today!why work at absorb software: all the perks:competitive salarypaid parkingfull benefits (health, dental and vision)8 hour workdays, including lunch (usually 9-5 or 8-4)a creative space:lively open concept workspaceeight xbox one consoles with seating for 16foosball and table hockeyour office is located inside the atlantic avenue art block, directly above delicious amenities such as bite groceteria cafe and gravity coffee shop & winebar. located in the vibrant community of inglewood, an historic area home to many restaurants, shops and art & culture venues. just minutes away from downtown calgary.key responsibilities: create reports and visualization models (descriptive analytics) for business leaders, in a clear and concise manner, using bi applicationscreate forecast models (predictive analytics) for business leaders on the future performance of the businesscontribute to the development of insights-driven action plans (prescriptive analytics) for the various business unitsprovide in-depth technical expertise with all aspects of the bi implementation, including requirements definition, data acquisition processes, data business intelligence programmer





location – london, ontario, canada
applicants must be legally entitled to work in canada at the time of application.  candidates must have one of the following to be eligible for consideration – canadian citizenship, valid permanent resident status, valid protected person status or a valid open work permit.
business intelligence (bi) programmer
do you have an inexplicable fondness for numbers? does pulling data make your heart sing? do you dream about pivot tables? having a hard time explaining this to friends and family? at big blue bubble, we understand…
analytics is an increasingly critical part of the modern game company.  at big blue bubble, we’ve tripled the size of our business intelligence team in the last year.  as a member of our growing team, you will be working behind-the-scenes developing tools to monitor and report on all mission-critical metrics associated with our games. you’ll get hands-on experience with amazon web services, api development and front/back-end dashboard maintenance and extension.
updating our analytics systems is like changing the tires of a moving car – and that means that the contribution of every member of the programming team is critical.
in this position these are the things you will be responsible for:

planning and developing code bases for internal data display dashboard, api interfaces, and analysis scripts.
maintaining and support existing code.
writing, testing, debugging and document code and processes.
managing amazon web services resources, including setup, maintenance, and provisioning.
working with other departments/teams within the company to provide controlled access to metrics systems and data.

to be an effective team member, you will have:

a degree in computer science, computer engineering, or data analytics.
strong knowledge of c++, c# or java. practical experience with sql, php, javascript.
familiarity with web servers and services.
the ability to understand and interpret analytics.
excellent problem solving with mad math skills (calculus/statistics/linear algebra)
experience with source control systems such as svn and git.
familiarity with linux and shell scripting.
a solid knowledge of software concepts such as data structures, object-oriented programming and design patterns.
experience working with amazon web services (sqs, sns, kinesis, redshift, emr).

 you also have the following attributes and skills: 

detail oriented
self-directed
clear communicator
able to meet deadlines

we know the above list is detailed. we don’t expect you to meet all of our criteria but we are looking for proven experience with an appetite and passion for growth. if you think you fit the role then please get in touch with us now to explore the opportunity further!
big blue bubble is an equal opportunity employer. applicants who require reasonable accommodation to complete the application and/or interview process should notify the hr director. apply now

october 11, 2017 min salary:  $55,574.00/year max salary:  $69,467.00/year the city of airdrie fosters a culture of accountability and values open dialogue, innovation and entrepreneurial spirit, collaborative relationships, learning, ownership, and encouraging the heart. we are searching for another team member who will help us get to the next level. business unit information: in partnership with the community, the city of airdrie rcmp is committed to providing a safe place to live, work and visit while optimizing quality of life. this is done through education and enforcing municipal and provincial laws in a fair, just and professional manner. primary accountabilities include: providing real-time support to officers while members attend dispatched calls for servicedata entry involving several data base systems such as pros, cpic, joinpreparation of legal documents in an electronic format for court disclosureawareness of crime trends and dissemination of information regarding crime patterns to appropriate units within the detachmentdetermining relevant intelligence information and relaying it to investigators in a real-time environmentdelivering crucial officer safety information within the confines of police radio communications guidelines education/experience requirements: prior experience working in an rcmp environment and knowledge of pros and cpic operating systems is requiredtwo to three years of administrative assistance experiencepost-secondary education in the administrative field is preferred skills and attributes: high level of confidentiality, tact and diplomacyindependent decision-making, problem solving and analytical skillsstrong organizational skills ability to quickly align with shifting priorities, work assignments and timelines in a result based environmenthighly motivated and able to work effectively in a fast paced environmenteye for detail and accuracy with strong recall abilityability to deal effectively with people in nights, weekends and statutory holidays.this position offers a comprehensive benefits and pension package.please provide a cover letter as a means of introducing yourself and your interest in this role.*the successful candidate must have or be able to obtain the rcmp enhanced reliability clearance (10 years of history along with an interview by an rcmp member). application process: candidates job postings: non union apply for position senior programmer/systems analyst  (171165) posted: 08/23/2017 11:24:06 am   we currently have an opportunity for a regular full time senior programmer/systems analyst in the decision support department located at the bayivew campus.  summary of duties: the performance measurement and reporting team within sunnybrook health sciences centre is seeking a full-time permanent senior programmer / systems analyst, focusing on database development, modelling, & data architectureto support the broader business intelligence vision, which will: put compelling data, grounded in a single source of truth, at the fingertips of decision-makers to track, plan and analyze activity at sunnybrook ensuring we are providing high quality care to patients when it matters most o provide evidence to support and monitor activity that can be shifted to partner health system providers as appropriate, using comparative and consistent methodology support discovery and innovation by being responsive and attentive to information needs, providing key standard reports efficiently, allowing more time to be spent on targeted, actionable and transformational analytics inform teaching and learning initiatives across the organization by engaging with stakeholders, centralizing transparent, subject-specific reports, encouraging consistent messaging and providing support to track and measure success. job duties and responsibilities: design, develop and support databases, data marts, data dictionaries and metadata repositories lead data preparation activities including exploration, cleansing, validation, integration, transformation, and aggregation of data design and implement technical enhancements to the enterprise data warehouse, including database design, etl processes, access and security develop of etl processes and re-usable packages according to standards reflecting industry-specific best practices develop sql queries and complex sql joins, triggers and stored procedures participate in the analysis and resolution of issues related to information content, data integrity, integration, and performance conduct proactive database monitoring to identify performance improvement opportunities work as part of a development team; create structured code for integration into larger systems, as well as documentation for ongoing maintenance in production environments work closely with data architects, project managers, quality assurance analysts and business intelligence consultants conduct research and make recommendations on database products, services, protocols, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts qualifications/skills: computer science or engineering degree with at least 5 years of relevant experience proficiency with ms sql server, sql server development, & t-sql etl expertise using ms sql server 2008 ssis or later data warehousing experience, including an understanding of fundamental concepts, schemas, and dimensional snowflake models understanding of major rdbms; including ms sql, oracle, & access knowledge and experience with both waterfall/sdlc and agile development methodologies past involvement with architectural systems design (client/server, distributed multi-tier) experience developing and administrating sharepoint 2013 experience with sql server analysis services (ssas), and microsoft sql server data tools 2012 qualifications & skills – preferred: experience in a healthcare environment exposure to formalized data governance, data quality processes and master data management processes privacy and security concepts exposure to business intelligence (bi) tools prior experience leading bi and dw projects within a healthcare environment is considered a strong asset. in addition to the above technical skills, all candidates for the above roles shall possess: excellent oral and written communication skills analytical abilities and ability to work effectively with technical & business users ability to understand business requirements and convert them to functional specifications ability to create technical and functional documentation ability to work effectively with all levels of management qualified candidates are invited to submit their resumes and cover letters, in one document, quoting file 171165 to: human resources sunnybrook health sciences centre to apply, please click "apply for position" near the top right corner of this page sunnybrook health sciences centre is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda). if you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter. sunnybrook health sciences centre is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, lgbtq persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. data focused ref no. clg501000032 salary negotiable location montreal, qc, canada start date asap job type contract (12 months minimum ) job status open apply now save email share: introduction we are embarking on a project to improve the provisioning, storing, querying and analysing of our it infrastructure data (comprised of hundreds of millions of data elements). as part of this project we will be replacing our data management platform, which is based on traditional data warehouse tooling (e.g. batch-based etl ' s and relational databases), to a data pipeline stack (e.g. message-based data pipeline and nosql databases ). we are looking for a data-focused java developer to join our team.the core function for this position is to build a configurable, high performance and highly available data pipeline that will verify, transform and load data into various databases (sql and nosql). the solution should be able to handle a batch-based loads as well as message-based data feeds.the role requires someone who is self-motivated, quick-learning and comfortable working across numerous technologies, who can take ownership of critical problems and work throughout the full project lifecycle from problem analysis to successful delivery. important java, etl, nosql the job skills (required) : - date: 
sep 27, 2017
                


location: 
verdun, qc, ca


company: 
bell


req id: 177497 
 
bell is a truly canadian company with over 137 years of success. we are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company’s vast potential.
 
to ensure we continue to be recognized as canada’s leading communications company, we’re committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. this means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.  
if you’re passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.
 
the bell residential services team is in the business of enabling customers to connect with people, information and entertainment by delivering integrated products and service experience for consumers while enhancing our competitiveness in the marketplace.  the team provides customers with bell home phone, local and long distance services, bell internet, bell satellite tv and amazing new technologies such as bell fibe tv.
 
the role:
the business intelligence & strategic planning (small business) team within brsb provides reporting and analytical insight to the marketing, sales in support of day-to-day operations and strategic planning.  the team plays an integral role in decision-making at multiple levels of management through complex analyses, predictive modeling, data mining, reporting, and external research. 
 
this is a terrific opportunity for the right candidate to contribute to an enterprising and successful team that will continue to help the organization drive one of the key mandates within bell.
 
responsibilities

manage incoming analytics and reporting requests and engage stakeholders to understand the underlying business problem, base assumptions and desired outcomes
advice & manage creation of targeted marketing campaigns for all sales tactics used by the small business team (direct mail & email, telemarketing, face to face ect…)
qualify requirements as ad hoc or recurring performance indicators and build solution accordingly
collaborate with business partners to identify opportunities to apply new bi insights to various areas of the organization
present key findings to management teams and business stakeholders
identify opportunities to improve delivery of bi insights to business stakeholders
enforce standards around documentation and overall quality of deliverables
act as steward for standards around data model, data dictionary and implementation of business rules and definitions

 
critical qualifications 

bachelor’s/master’s degree in business, bi, information technology, engineering, mathematics & statistics and/or related fields
2+ years experience in sql programming
2+ years experience in bi, analytics or related disciplines
excellent written and oral communicator with a demonstrable history of developing strong partnerships and cross-team collaboration
strong business acumen, with an appreciation for the need to quickly execute in an ever-evolving competitive environment
ability to quickly analyze information and determine “what does this mean for the business”

 
preferred qualifications 

working knowledge of sas enterprise guide
working knowledge of teradata, oracle
experience with data modeling and predictive analytics
knowledge of telecommunication sector
ability to negotiate and influence others
proven project management and change management skills
experience with tableau and/or other reporting tools

bce:wkp #feature *li-st1 tc:bm/ 98#li-st1
 
bilingualism is an asset (english and french)
 
additional information:
position type: management
job location: canada : quebec : montreal || canada : quebec : verdun
application deadline: 10/10/2017
 
please apply directly online to be considered for this role. applications through email will not be accepted.
 
bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

title: Data Analytics Specialists -MH
text: data analytics specialists -mh job - oci inc. - victoria, bc | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobsfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province data analytics specialists -mh oci inc. - victoria, bc contract only professionals with im, it, is and/or ict experience need apply .must be current resident of canada.location: victoria, bc.start date: oct/nov, 2017.assignment length: 6-12 months initial contract; option to extend for up to 3 years.position/project summary: we are seeking there (3) intermediate data analytics specialists who have the capacity and ability to lead, support and coordinate projects efficiently. the projects may involve multiple stakeholder groups at various levels, both internal and external to the ministry, and may range in complexity. projects may also have dependencies or linkages to other projects which may or may not be managed by the respondent to deliver. the work will be performed using data from the ministry and other health and socioeconomic databases; and business intelligence and analytics tools including, but not limited to, statistical analysis system (sas), microstrategy, and tableau; and structured query language (sql) with various direct query tools (e.g., plsql developer, toad, benthic software: golden).responsibilities/deliverables / scope of work: the intermediate data analytics specialists responsibilities / deliverables will include one or more of the following, but may not be limited to:foundational areas such as planning;data sourcing and processing;statistical processing;development of data and forecasting tools;quality assurance;report preparation and visual representation; andtechnical documentation and knowledge transfer.deliverables: the intermediate data analytics specialists will provide deliverables that may include, but are not limited to, the following:complex, cross-system, data profiling and segregation, and cohort analysis;health economics modeling (e.g., predictive, optimization, econometric, simulation modeling and hypothesis testing);forecasting, projections and time series analysis;“what if” scenario analysis;health system analysis and impact assessment (e.g., standard reporting, environmental scans, literature reviews, retrospective analysis, research, population health trending);health data, domain, or clinical subject matter expert;interactive data visualization and dashboard creation; and,methodology and definitions development and support.experience, skills and qualification: the intermediate data analytics specialists should have any of the following experience, skills and qualifications:degree, diploma or certificate in related field;minimum 3+ years experience in data analytics;minimum 7+ years experience information/data management field;experience in data and information quality management would be a strong asset;abel to provide 3 project examples where they have produced some of the deliverable (a-h) listed above;past analytics experience with the health sector in canada, and especially within british columbia, would be considered an asset.how to apply: we thank all applicants for their interest, however only those shortlisted will be contacted. we will retain your resume for other current or upcoming relevant roles.please send your updated ms word resume quoting full role title, dta-170964i through easy apply or ocihr@myoci .ca and include:availability:work location preference:rate expectation or range for guidelines:_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________oci inc. is canadian based information technology (it) service company headquartered in toronto, with offices in ottawa, edmonton, calgary, vancouver and victoria. we have been successfully working with the private and public sector in canada, usa and globally since 1998 . www.myoci.cajob type: contractjob location:victoria, bcrequired education:bachelor'srequired experience:data analytics: 3 years 13 days ago - save job » apply now please review job description - advanced business analyst, business intelligence (19919)go to the main content section.email subscriptions | contact usdelivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of lifehomeabout usnewsinvestor relationscareershomecareersnorth america and emea (excl. continental europe)north america and emea (excl. continental europe)printcareerscareersasia-pacificcontinental europeemea (excl. continental europe)indianorth americawelcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionssign inthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy jobpagebasic search|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - advanced business analyst, business intelligence (19919)job description advanced business analyst, business intelligence-19919description 
invesco is a leading global asset management firm with more than $858b* in assets under management. we provide our retail and institutional clients a diverse and comprehensive range of investment capabilities to help people get more out of life. invesco is publicly traded on the new york stock exchange (ivz) and has about 7,000 employees in over 20 countries. (*as of june 30, 2017)
 
advanced business analyst, business intelligence
 
please note this position is based out of our charlottetown, pei office.  individuals are required to work on-site.  
job purpose (job summary): the pmo efficiency and effectiveness (e2) team exists to evolve and adapt operational efficiencies that enable technology and business partners to deliver strategic objectives. the e2 team provides leadership of methodologies, best practices and domain knowledge for a range of services such as agile, lean, service management and data visualization & reporting. the pmo e2 team is seeking an advanced bi business analyst that can support and develop our existing data visualization & reporting capabilities. the analyst will play a key role in accelerating and improving organizational decision making using existing tools and technologies. in addition, they will be instrumental in recognizing technology trends and maturing new products that further enhance our reporting and visualization capabilities.
key responsibilities / duties: 

provide business analysis expertise to interpret client data requirements that delivers impactful reporting to help enable strategic decisions
regularly engage and consult with various data consumers to champion reporting best practices and standards that helps improve their overall reporting abilities
translate client requirements into visual dashboards for management reporting
work directly with technical developers to deliver reporting and data visualization solutions
analyze and understand business user metrics and key performance indicators to ensure accurate data reporting
serve as a key contributor to a reporting center of excellence that establishes guidelines, communicates best practices and provides training
periodically take a lead role on small projects and continuous improvement initiatives to improve existing reports and dashboards
qualifications 
work experience / knowledge: 

minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analysis and reporting role
proven experience with reporting tools such as power bi and ssrs
experience with sql queries is preferred

skills / other personal attributes required: 

excellent written and verbal communication skills
strong analysis and problem resolutions at both a strategic and functional level
skilled with data visualization techniques to help users understand information by placing in a visual context
ability to multi-task while leading concurrent initiatives
flexibility to meet changing requirements and priorities
possess a structured and disciplined approach to work with strong attention to detail
have a track record of disciplined time management skills
self-motivated, capable of working with little or no supervision
strong presentation skills
ability to react positively under pressure to meet tight deadlines
ability to work independently or as a team player
ability to influence and build relationships at all levels of staff
enjoy challenging and thought provoking work and have a strong desire to learn and progress
experience working in a global, multicultural environment

formal education: (minimum requirement to perform job duties)

bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

the above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this role. it is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. the job holder may be required to perform other duties as deemed appropriate by their manager from time to time.invesco is committed to fair and accessible employment practices. if selected for an interview, we will work with you to ensure that your interview is accessible and accommodation is provided. please contact us at accessibility@invesco.ca or 1.800.874.6275 to let us know if you require accommodation for an interview due to a disability.job corporate and administrative servicesprimary locationnorth america-canada-prince edward island-charlottetown-119 euston streetschedule full-time   ©2016 invescohomeabout usnewsinvestor relationscareerscontact usselect a regionexplore our investment capabilities in your region.australiacanada (english)canada (francais)dubaieuropeguernseyhong kongisle of manjapanjerseytaiwanunited kingdomunited statesthe investment market commentary on this site is a sample of commentary written by invesco professionals around the globe and is not an offer of any product or service.if you are interested in obtaining more information, please select a region to be directed to your local jurisdiction's website.email subscriptionspress releasesearnings releasesinvestor centercontact us

#weareshaw job description every day, our passionate employees connect our customers to the world and everything in it – it’s why we exist at shaw, and it’s why we strive to be the place where the best people choose to work. our people reflect the richness of our communities, and our culture is inclusive of each individual’s diverse background and perspective, which makes us a stronger team.at shaw we believe a diverse workforce fosters diversity of thought and perspective, and more diversity means more solutions. we invite all qualified individuals to apply. career opportunity: data analyst shaw cablesystems g.p. has an exciting opportunity for a data analyst in our calgary office, reporting to the manager, business intelligence - delivery. the successful candidate will be responsible for designing and developing automated data and reporting solutions that process, summarize and bring order to raw data, transforming it into actionable information on which our business partners can make decisions. accountabilities/ responsibilities: • design and deliver automated report solutions that summarize and transform data from various data sources into understandable, actionable information. • develop and improve data mart structures and bi report development/delivery processes to improve efficiency, usability, consistency, reliability and relevance of reports. • collect and converge requirements from end users; translate requirements into technical solutions. • collaborate with business partners to identify opportunities to apply bi insights to various areas of the organization. • support and troubleshoot technical problems within the bi environment. • understand and remain current on shaw product offerings, promotions, and associated order entry / order management procedures. required skills, experience and qualifications: • 7+ years creating automated reports, using advanced techniques with various systems and tools, and with emphasis on efficient, high quality code and identification/mitigation of data integrity problems. • 7+ years and a solid understanding of sql, and other db constructs including stored procedures, functions, views and execution plans. advanced knowledge of code optimization, including development/coding best practices. • 5+ years, a solid understanding, and demonstrated ability to apply data warehouse and data modeling methodologies into practice. with a focus on the ability to understand the underlying data sources and translating that knowledge into mapping documents and requirements for etl developers. • experience acting as a mentor to peers, providing guidance on technical solutions, critical thinking, and storytelling via data - relating the data (‘what’ and ‘when’) to the ‘why’ and ‘how’ parts of our business. • hands on experience developing reports and architecture layer objects in microstrategy. • demonstrated business acumen. ability to obtain essential information about a situation, focus on the key objectives, recognize the relevant options available, select an appropriate course of action and set in motion a plan to “get the job done”. • have a track record of delivering outputs that set the bar for quality, delivering complete solutions which are thoughtful, forward thinking (considering future impacts) and follows all internal processes perfectly. • ability to communicate with technical teams as well as business users. • demonstrated ability to build strong, cooperative intradepartmental and interdepartmental relationships. • consistently able to work under pressure, multi-task and meet challenging deadlines, all while focusing on quality. • team player with strong, proactive, communication skills. • a positive “can do” attitude that will enable you to deal with challenging situations with integrity, empathy and sincerity. if you want to be part of something bigger—part of a dynamic team of people who are aligned, focused, and passionate about working together to care for our customers, then we look forward to meeting you! join us.we thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted. this position requires successful completion of a criminal and credit background check.shaw communications, through its third party vendor, collects and stores information applicable to the candidate profile you create when you submit the information asked for below. the use and disclosure of the collected information is for the sole purpose of job search and placement activities for shaw communications. the information is subject to personal information protection and electronic documents act. the information will be retained and when disposed of, it is done so in a secure manner. your profile will become inactive and moved to the archive if you do not access your profile for a period of 1 year. view disclaimer we thank all applicants for their interest; however, only selected candidates will be contacted. no date: 
2017-09-19
                

 référence: 28301-fr_ca


type de poste : permanent 
lieu principal : montréal, québec, canada 
emplacements additionnels : montréal 
poste le conseiller principal microsoft business intelligence est responsable de concevoir et de fournir des applications de veille stratégique performantes à nos clients en dirigeant une équipe de conseillers avec le directeur de projet. le candidat idéal est un architecte microsoft chevronné qui se passionne pour les nouvelles technologies et la gestion du rendement, et qui est toujours prêt à interagir directement avec les clients.
responsabilités

diriger les validations de principe à l’aide des technologies appropriées de microsoft business intelligence.
diriger les étapes d’analyse, de conception, de développement et de mise à l’essai.
documenter les processus d’affaires et les exigences d’affaires et du système.
fournir les spécifications liées à l’outil etl ou aux flux de données axés sur les services.
établir et mettre en œuvre la stratégie infonuagique microsoft business intelligence.
diriger la conception de la base de données pour les solutions suivantes : entrepôt de données, centre de données, lac de données, gestion des données de base et données massives.
soutenir les tests et les essais d’acceptation par l’utilisateur intégrés.
orienter le réglage de la performance.
agir à titre de leader sur place pour le centre de développement canadien.
soutenir le directeur de projet et le chef de mêlée.
définir des pratiques et une méthodologie de développement efficaces pour l’équipe.
guider les développeurs tout au long des étapes de développement.
déployer des solutions liées à la méthode devops du client.
participer à l’élaboration de propositions de projet et de demandes d’information.

participer aux activités de développement des affaires.
qualificationscompétences

un minimum de 10 ans d'expérience pertinente.
titulaire d’un baccalauréat.
solide expérience de travail dans un environnement lié à microsoft business intelligence (ssis, ssas, ssrs, power bi).
trois ans d’expérience au moins en exécution de divers projets concernant les technologies microsoft azure.
expérience liée à la méthodologie agile.
expérience éprouvée en conception et en développement à titre d’architecte ou de conseiller principal microsoft business intelligence dans des environnements complexes.
expérience de travail en ce qui a trait au dépannage des problèmes liés aux requêtes, aux rapports, aux cubes ou aux tableaux de bord dans microsoft business intelligence.
expérience en développement à l’aide d’outils de contrôle des versions, par exemple tfs.
connaissances de ms project, des plateformes agile et de visio.
bonnes aptitudes pour la communication écrite et orale, en français et en anglais.
expérience éprouvée en exécution d’analyses des écarts et des incidences.
expérience en soutien des utilisateurs d’affaires travaillant sur des projets ou programmes comprenant de nombreuses applications ou sources de données fortement interdépendantes.         
capacité éprouvée de collaboration avec des organisations clientes.
aptitude à travailler avec des équipes diversifiées à distance et à les diriger.
expérience en gestion du changement.

démarrez votre carrière en beauté. quelle influence aurez-vous?
nous sommes toujours à la recherche de personnes qui ont l’énergie et la motivation nécessaires pour se dépasser et pour trouver de nouvelles manières d’atteindre nos objectifs communs. chez deloitte, nous savons que pour être le chef de file incontesté, nous devons permettre à nos gens d’atteindre leur plein potentiel afin qu’ils aient une influence marquante sur les clients, les collègues et la collectivité de même que sur leur propre carrière.
 
nous offrons une expérience réellement distinctive en matière de talent qui permet à nos gens d’accomplir un travail valorisant; nous leur offrons aussi des occasions de croissance, d’apprentissage et de leadership où qu’ils en soient dans leur carrière. les nouveaux bureaux de deloitte offrent un espace de travail unique qui renforce les liens entre nos gens, leur inspire de nouvelles façons de travailler et leur fournit les outils nécessaires pour avoir une influence marquante. et grâce à notre portée et à notre réseau mondiaux, vous ferez toujours partie de la communauté de deloitte.
 
« deloitte un jour, deloitte toujours. »
 
prenez les rênes de votre vie. prenez les rênes d’une équipe. prenez les rênes du cabinet. toutes ces possibilités s’offrent à vous chez deloitte.

deloitte, l’un des cabinets de services professionnels les plus importants au canada, offre des services dans les domaines de l’audit, de la fiscalité, de la consultation et des conseils financiers dans l’ensemble du canada. chez deloitte, nous jumelons notre connaissance du secteur à une profonde compréhension des enjeux d’affaires locaux et mondiaux actuels afin de fournir à nos clients des solutions judicieuses, pratiques et fondées sur les principes dont ils ont besoin pour résoudre les problèmes d’aujourd’hui et de demain. 
 
 
laissez deloitte vous montrer comment progresser dans votre cheminement. et donnez vie à votre histoire.
 
deloitte est un employeur inclusif qui s’est engagé à créer une main-d’œuvre diversifiée. nous invitons tous les candidats qualifiés à postuler et nous effectuerons les aménagements nécessaires afin de répondre à leurs besoins, conformément aux codes provinciaux des droits de la personne, à toutes les étapes du processus de recrutement et de sélection. veuillez aviser le recruteur pour vous assurer que vos besoins en matière d’accessibilité sont respectés tout au long du processus. les renseignements reçus relativement aux aménagements seront traités de façon confidentielle.
 
nous remercions tous les candidats qui manifesteront leur intérêt, mais nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue.

analystreviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. experienced with business process re engineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make homecareerswork @ utopia imagebusiness intelligence analyst
















business intelligence analyst







the customer experience management team has three key mandates in support of utopia image’s mission: data collection, business intelligence and offering strategic advice.  in summary, our responsibilities consist in conducting telephone follow-ups for customer experience and customer satisfaction campaigns from our clients, which allows us to provide them with constructive feedback on their own customers’ opinion and perceptions of the employee’s know-how. this insight enables our clients to identify the required action plans to improve the delivery (processes) and execution (behaviour) in servicing their clientele. when required, we assist them in the development and implementation of these changes and initiatives.  under the responsibility of the vice president, customer experience management, the business intelligence analyst will be responsible for analyzing raw data responses for various campaigns. he/she will identify and communicate best practices and opportunities for improvement towards operational processes – which will in turn promote customer retention. he/she must understand our clients’ reality, objectives, priorities and comments while synthesizing all the data gathered to prepare insightful opportunistic reports.



responsibilities 

work with internal and external stakeholders as well as it partners to develop and analyze business intelligence requirements;work with our customers and it teams to transform data in critical information that empowers our customers to make sound business decisions; analyze data gathered from various platforms for internal and client’s requests;transform data into actionable insights and present findings to internal partners and clients;look for business problems and create models that help predict and analyze these situations;develop and deliver training materials, provide support and offer training for end users for our bi dashboards and reporting tools; review competitive data and industry trends to determine where the firm is in the marketplace, where it can improve, increase its operational efficiency, and how it can stand out from the competition with its customer experience delivery;develop policies and procedures for data collection and analysis;monitor analysis and measurements results;review client files to ensure the integrity of data collection and usage;perform data profiling.



training and experience 

bachelor's degree in business administration, information systems or mathematics with a data science program or equivalent;two to three years of relevant professional experience in a bi or data analyst position with practical experience in complex data analysis;ability to understand and find appropriate solutions to data and analysis results;ability to translate complex data into reports or visuals such as charts, dashboards, and report tracking tools that can be used by a variety of audiences; anticipate, identify and define problems;investigate root causes and implement practical and relevant solutions;ability to work independently or in a team and to meet predetermined deadlines;exceptional data manipulation skills using digital computing, graphing, data analysis (including pivottables) and excel software programming;outstanding presentation skills (powerpoint), the ability to effectively and clearly communicate data, analysis and results to all stakeholders;knowledge of sql and database systems (oracle, sql server, teradata) an asset;experience with technologies/approaches to extraction, transformation and data loading (etl) an asset.



requirements 

excellent technical and analytical skills;excellent communication skills (dissemination of information);problem solver;good priority management skills and sense of initiative;fluency in french and english, both oral and written.

the provincial health services authority (phsa) plans, manages and evaluates selected specialty and province-wide health care services across bc, working with the five geographic health authorities to deliver province-wide solutions that improve the health of british columbians. phsa embodies values that reflect a commitment to excellence. these include: patients first • respect people • be compassionate • dare to innovate • cultivate partnerships • serve with purpose.hr business intelligence analystjob requisition #62935burnaby, bcreporting to the hris manager, the primary focus for the business intelligence (bi) analyst is to develop and maintain “extract transform load” (etl) solutions for hr related data sources. the analyst works closely with bi team lead and other hris specialists to audit identify and follow-up on issues related to data quality, metric definitions or process deficiencies. responsibilities also include database development and monitoring, data modeling, data dictionary development and maintenance, ad-hoc reporting, report development, documentation, maintenance of users and user permissions. analyst is responsible for problem identification and documentation with respect to data stored in hris databases. this position is also responsible for support and liaison with technology services for hardware and network problems as it relates to hris data warehouse and bi environments.the role requires excellent analytical skills and ability to turn complex business requirements into analysis ready data-sets, data-marts, cubes or data-models. although the primary communication is with hr analysts and hris specialists, the role communicates with hr staff at all levels to ensure their requirements are met. having access to private and sensitive data, this role requires the knowledge of privacy and confidentiality policies and procedures.key accountabilitiesdesigns, develops and maintains hris databases, etl, olap cubes, reports, dashboards and other bi content as required.works collaboratively with clients and business analysts to gather requirements, create definitions and specifications and translate those into data models, etl packages and reports as appropriate.administers the sql server databases (hr data marts) including security, user permissions, performance and usage monitoring.maintains data quality and ensures data integrity and daily refresh of hris data warehouse and olap cubes and bi content.maintains lookup tables, writes technical and user documentation, troubleshoots issues with reports, data sources, performance and other related dutieswrites ad-hoc queries and reports to support hr analysts and leaders in data analysis.creates and maintains report subscriptions for hr staff and operational leaders across participating organizations.provides first line support to users for all hris published bi content.provides technical and educational support to hris specialists and hr analysts and report writers.maintains the hris reporting environment (sql ssrs, tableau, sharepoint team site)collaborates with the tech services, vendors and other teams on hardware and software implementation, upgrades and troubleshooting as it relates to hris database and bi software and hardware.communicates with external clients such as heabc, ministry of health, wsbc etc. on definitions, ad-hoc queries and regular data/report submissions as directed by hr stakeholders.ensures that hris databases, reports and other bi content are developed and maintained in accordance with phsa privacy and confidentiality guidelines.evaluates the current solutions, researches new and alternative technologies, processes and approaches according to industry best practices.qualificationsa level of education, training, and experience equivalent to degree or diploma in information systems or computer science from a recognized school, plus a minimum of three (3) years recent related work experience preferably in a healthcare environment. development experience with the ms sharepoint bi toolset required.an in-depth working knowledge of relational and multidimensional (olap) databases as well as a proven knowledge and experience in working with sql server bi stack. administrative experience including setting up new users, monitoring performance, and query tuning.ability and experience to develop technical documentation. ability to understand management reporting and statistical concepts. demonstrated ability to analyze operational problems and recommend innovative solutions. ability to work in teams on projects with little or no supervision. self-directed and motivated to learn new technology including hardware, software applications, and programming applications. ability to organize workload, set priorities and meet deadlines in a dynamic environment. ability and flexibility to multi-task. ability to communicate effectively in english both verbally and in writing. ability to quickly adapt to new technology. physical ability to perform the duties of the job.we invite you to apply by clicking the "apply online now" button where you can register for the first time or enter your username and password in order to re-access your profile on our system.resumes will be accepted until the position is filled.for more information about phsa please visit the website at: www.phsa.cathe phsa is committed to employment equity and hires on the basis of merit. we encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities.
