date: 
sep 14, 2017
                


location: 
mississauga, on, ca


company: 
bell


simply put, customers, innovation, and success are at the heart of what we do at the source and why we do it.  these three words shape our business decisions and our everyday actions.  they are the foundation of our commitment to being a great place to work and becoming the customers’ consumer electronics and communication store of choice! join us and discover a career that is challenging and rewarding.
 
who you’ll work with
at the source we offer expert training and further opportunities for professional growth and development. we are looking for professionals who are passionate, driven to learn and make a difference in an industry that is continuously changing! be the leader you’ve always wanted to be—in a fun, fast-paced and competitive industry. 
 
we're all working toward one goal: supporting our sales team in creating a shopping experience that will keep our customers coming back. sound like a team you want to be a part of? our talent acquisition team can't wait to meet you!

are you passionate about the customer experience and have the drive to ensure that the design and execution of our sales strategy is successful?
do you thrive in a fast paced environment?
are you an effective, confident communicator that knows the right questions to ask to get the job done?
do you want to be a key player in evolving the long term sales strategy at the source?

 
if you answered yes to these questions this is an excellent opportunity to work in a high profile, challenging environment!
 
the business intelligence analyst is a key member of the source’s retail execution team.  the team plays an integral role in the design and execution of weekly, quarterly and yearly sales plans for the source.
 
reporting to the senior manager, retail insights & sales planning, the candidate will have the opportunity to influence the daily sales operations and steer the long-term sales growth strategy at the source by providing analytical insights to optimize sales productivity in a multi-unit environment totalizing more than 450 stores nationally. 
 
the candidate will work closely with all levels of sales management and will interact with key business partners from merchandising, marketing, finance, product, business intelligence, and as well, groups within bell mobility and bell residential services.
 
responsibilities

complete regular sales volume planning and sales target setting
support inventory planning and analysis for the wireless business
provide ad-hoc analysis and recommendations to support performance management activities
support quarterly sales plan design
provide  regular recommendations to the sales and the marketing leadership team to support and influence their decision making when developing new strategies to grow the business
work with business partners to gather, validate and document business requirements to develop sales kpi reporting

 
required skills

proven ability to gather and manipulate a large sets of data coming from numerous sources and systems
proven data analytical ability with a focus on detail, accuracy, complex problem solving and logic capabilities
proficient in advanced ms powerpoint functions and ms excel functions such as pivot tables, v-lookup functions, ms access and general data manipulation
excellent understanding of the telecommunications industry
ability to multi-task and understand competing priorities following through to the completion of assigned projects
excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to clearly and convincingly communicate and influence both in written and oral

 
preferred qualifications

university/college degree in business
preferred to have wireless industry or retail operations experience
2-3 years of experience in a similar job function
ability to speak french is an asset.

position type: corporate careers
position: analyst, business intelligence - the source 
job location: canada : ontario : mississauga  
application deadline: 10/09/2017 
 
it’s all about you
we're proud to offer a competitive compensation package including an extensive recognition and rewards program, career advancement opportunities, awesome training programs, competitive medical and dental benefits, charity and volunteer opportunities and of course, associate discounts!
the source celebrates and embraces diversity as part of our company culture. we strive to be an inclusive, equitable and accessible environment that supports both our internal and external customers, ensuring everyone feels valued and respected.

business intelligence analyst

bookmark this posting |
    print preview |
        apply for this job



posting details



position information



job title
business intelligence analyst


hours per week/fte
35


responsibilities
the glass is never half full or half empty, instead it is twice as big as it needs to be. if you find this statement logical, please keep reading. institutional planning, analysis and risk services is looking for a creative yet analytical thinker to join our team.  the ideal person will have the ability to build universes, mine data, create analytical reports, present complex statistics and turn information into actionable intelligence.  the primary function of the business intelligence analyst position is to make evidence based decisions easy at lethbridge college.
the incumbent will be responsible for the overall coordination of the college’s business intelligence (bi) systems to reflect organizational need and to provide bi support for the development of relevant planning documents, models and dashboards.  this requires the ability to design, develop and maintain these materials to effectively utilize bi support for measuring and evaluating strategic outcomes, and performance metrics.
this position is also responsible for providing assistance for applicable accountability reporting and associated functions to alberta advanced education.


job duties
specific job duties include:
•	provide bi support for the development and maintenance of highly complex reports, institutional dashboards, performance metrics, and planning models such as enrolment planning, tuition and program health.
•	overall coordination of the bi systems including a shared responsibility with it services for system design, development, upgrades and ongoing maintenance and user security maintenance and protection of institutional data integrity.
•	contribute to the preparation of accountability reporting to advanced education where applicable.
•	provide expertise and strategic insight into the development of institutional performance measures and reporting standards.
•	provide bi training, education and awareness to designated power users.


required qualifications
post-secondary education with a degree in a related field including economics, business, computer science or statistics or formal certification in business intelligence;
2-5 years of related experience in information technology and preferably a bi environment including reporting and analytics;
strong proficiency with excel and programming knowledge;
experience working with large data sets and a deep knowledge of bi principles, practices and methodologies;
experience with sap business objects, ellucian colleague considered a strong asset;
results driven team player with strong analytical and computer skills with the ability to anticipate end user needs.


preferred qualifications



salary
starting at $72,414 - $85,194; commensurate with education and experience.

permanent


position type:
full time

desk job


apply by:




description
we have a full time permanent opportunity at the beer store mississauga corporate office for a director of strategy.
this role will be leading the identification and development of strategic opportunities and initiatives to achieve long and short term objectives, supervising the execution of the company's long range strategic plan, providing analytical and execution support for strategic projects/issues and overseeing business transformation initiatives.
 
why join the beer store? 
we have a flexible and accommodating workplace, promoting work life balance. we are socially and environmentally responsible and have been green before green was cool! there are opportunities for professional growth and development within our organization and a genuine, friendly corporate culture. you’ll enjoy participation in our total rewards program which includes benefits the first day in your role, a competitive base salary, incentive plans, annual merit review, health, dental and pension benefits. apply now and find out more about our team!
 
key accountabilities: 


direct strategic planning for assigned enterprise initiatives, as well as for designated departments and business lines; identifies opportunities for business and service line expansion, complete with feasibility studies and risk analysis in collaboration with operating leaders


direct responsibility for and management of the project management office (pmo) in support of business transformation initiatives


partner with company leaders, outside organizations and stakeholders to manage the development and implementation of projects that support the company’s strategic objectives


identify risks to and opportunities from strategic initiatives and seeks to optimise the achievement of the long range plan.


identify threats both inside and outside the company that would impede continued success or opportunities to grow the business and increase market share; prepare competitive analysis for the purposes of performance benchmarking vs competitors and other industries for best practices.


evaluate new business models, strategic opportunities/partnerships, and internal operational plans through data-driven analysis and execution


develop and generate strategic recommendations through independent analysis of provincial regulations, governmental affairs and business environment


monitor of company and market performance to determine if strategies need to be adjusted and/or new strategies developed


maintain diverse knowledge of industry trends, regulatory compliance, competitive intelligence and market research with the ability to integrate the information into actionable strategic and long-range plans


provide analytical support for special projects as directed by the president/board
 
 


the ideal applicant will have: 


university degree in business, finance, strategy or a related area


a minimum of 8 -10 years’ broad business experience with strategy focused business projects


experience in leading cross functional teams and interacting in a cross-functional environment with senior management


demonstrated experience in relationship management, large-scale strategy development, transformation and project management


pmp/lean six sigma certification, change management experience would be an asset


excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams


demonstrated leadership ability, and the ability to challenge the expected and drive innovative thinking throughout the organization


strong decision-making, collaboration, conflict resolution and partnering skills


proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving
 


 
**please apply with your resume to this posting if interested. hiring date is asap***
 
we are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the ontario human rights code and the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act. if contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise human resources if you require accommodation.
** thank you for your interest in this role. only applicants that have been selected for an interview will be contacted. thank you. **

text: business intelligence analyst job - absorb software inc. - calgary, ab | indeed.ca skip to job description, searchclose find jobsfind resumesemployers / post job upload your resume sign in : what where advanced job search       job title, keywords or company city or province business intelligence analyst absorb software inc. - calgary, ab the position: the business intelligence analyst is responsible to empower absorb software’s management team to leverage high quality information, allowing for insightful decisions. the bi analyst provides consulting services to the leaders of the various business units to develop pertinent metrics and kpi’s distributed via centralized, and on demand, reports and dashboards. the main responsibilities also include contributing to the enhancement of the existing business intelligence infrastructure and processes. the candidate must be a critical thinker, known for their problem resolution skills, be a strong team player, self-motivated, and have good communication skills.the company: absorb software started out 14 years ago as a small e-learning company and has grown into a global player in the learning management system (lms) industry. if you've never heard of an lms before, don't worry, most of us hadn't either. you've probably used one though; maybe for a safety course or some corporate hr policy video. now imagine one of those that doesn't suck, and you have our flagship product, absorb lms . we provide our lms to big name clients like uber, airbnb, a&w, johnson & johnson, and lots of others with strange acronyms that you've never heard of. but enough about the lms, let's talk about us! our careers page should give you a pretty good idea of what to expect here: a fun, open and modern environment that is about as far from "corporate" as you can get. we believe that creating an awesome workplace is the best way to ensure that we deliver great service to our clients. if this sounds like the kind of place you want to work, send us your resume today!why work at absorb software: all the perks:competitive salarypaid parkingfull benefits (health, dental and vision)8 hour workdays, including lunch (usually 9-5 or 8-4)a creative space:lively open concept workspaceeight xbox one consoles with seating for 16foosball and table hockeyour office is located inside the atlantic avenue art block, directly above delicious amenities such as bite groceteria cafe and gravity coffee shop & winebar. located in the vibrant community of inglewood, an historic area home to many restaurants, shops and art & culture venues. just minutes away from downtown calgary.key responsibilities: create reports and visualization models (descriptive analytics) for business leaders, in a clear and concise manner, using bi applicationscreate forecast models (predictive analytics) for business leaders on the future performance of the businesscontribute to the development of insights-driven action plans (prescriptive analytics) for the various business unitsprovide in-depth technical expertise with all aspects of the bi implementation, including requirements definition, data acquisition processes, data warehousing, data modeling and process automationwork with cross functional teams to ensure coherence and strategic alignment of the various models implementedleverage expert knowledge of bi capabilities and trends to suggest and implement improvements to the existing bi infrastructure and processesstay up to date on the new features added to the various bi software tools used and recommend new feature implementations as neededmust haves: one to five (1-5) years’ prior experience as a business intelligence analyst leveraging data to drive business decisionsa university degree in business intelligence, mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, or another scientific fielddemonstrated experience with business intelligence tools, experience with power bi or dundas a major asset.a deep knowledge of relational database conceptsexperience programming in r or other statistical computing languages a major assetexperience working with executives and upper managementexceptional communication skills, both written and verbalnice to haves: experience working as part of a project teamit's important to us that we find the right person for the job, not necessarily the most qualified. if you aren't sure that you have all the skills we are looking for, but think you'd still be a great fit and are willing to learn, please feel free to apply.you must be able to provide proof of legal authorization to work in canada and for absorb software out of the calgary office.we look forward to hearing from you!job type: full-timejob location:calgary, abrequired experience:analytics tool (power bi, dundas, tableau, etc.): 1 yeardata warehouse implementation: 1 yearstatistical analysis and data forecasting: 1 year 16 days ago - save job » apply now please business intelligence programmer





location – london, ontario, canada
applicants must be legally entitled to work in canada at the time of application.  candidates must have one of the following to be eligible for consideration – canadian citizenship, valid permanent resident status, valid protected person status or a valid open work permit.
business intelligence (bi) programmer
do you have an inexplicable fondness for numbers? does pulling data make your heart sing? do you dream about pivot tables? having a hard time explaining this to friends and family? at big blue bubble, we understand…
analytics is an increasingly critical part of the modern game company.  at big blue bubble, we’ve tripled the size of our business intelligence team in the last year.  as a member of our growing team, you will be working behind-the-scenes developing tools to monitor and report on all mission-critical metrics associated with our games. you’ll get hands-on experience with amazon web services, api development and front/back-end dashboard maintenance and extension.
updating our analytics systems is like changing the tires of a moving car – and that means that the contribution of every member of the programming team is critical.
in this position these are the things you will be responsible for:

planning and developing code bases for internal data display dashboard, api interfaces, and analysis scripts.
maintaining and support existing code.
writing, testing, debugging and document code and processes.
managing amazon web services resources, including setup, maintenance, and provisioning.
working with other departments/teams within the company to provide controlled access to metrics systems and data.

to be an effective team member, you will have:

a degree in computer science, computer engineering, or data analytics.
strong knowledge of c++, c# or java. practical experience with sql, php, javascript.
familiarity with web servers and services.
the ability to understand and interpret analytics.
excellent problem solving with mad math skills (calculus/statistics/linear algebra)
experience with source control systems such as svn and git.
familiarity with linux and shell scripting.
a solid knowledge of software concepts such as data structures, object-oriented programming and design patterns.
experience working with amazon web services (sqs, sns, kinesis, redshift, emr).

 you also have the following attributes and skills: 

detail oriented
self-directed
clear communicator
able to meet deadlines

we know the above list is detailed. we don’t expect you to meet all of our criteria but we are looking for proven experience with an appetite and passion for growth. if you think you fit the role then please get in touch with us now to explore the opportunity further!
big blue bubble is an equal opportunity employer. applicants who require reasonable accommodation to complete the application and/or interview process should notify the hr director. apply now

job postings: non union apply for position senior programmer/systems analyst  (171165) posted: 08/23/2017 11:24:06 am   we currently have an opportunity for a regular full time senior programmer/systems analyst in the decision support department located at the bayivew campus.  summary of duties: the performance measurement and reporting team within sunnybrook health sciences centre is seeking a full-time permanent senior programmer / systems analyst, focusing on database development, modelling, & data architectureto support the broader business intelligence vision, which will: put compelling data, grounded in a single source of truth, at the fingertips of decision-makers to track, plan and analyze activity at sunnybrook ensuring we are providing high quality care to patients when it matters most o provide evidence to support and monitor activity that can be shifted to partner health system providers as appropriate, using comparative and consistent methodology support discovery and innovation by being responsive and attentive to information needs, providing key standard reports efficiently, allowing more time to be spent on targeted, actionable and transformational analytics inform teaching and learning initiatives across the organization by engaging with stakeholders, centralizing transparent, subject-specific reports, encouraging consistent messaging and providing support to track and measure success. job duties and responsibilities: design, develop and support databases, data marts, data dictionaries and metadata repositories lead data preparation activities including exploration, cleansing, validation, integration, transformation, and aggregation of data design and implement technical enhancements to the enterprise data warehouse, including database design, etl processes, access and security develop of etl processes and re-usable packages according to standards reflecting industry-specific best practices develop sql queries and complex sql joins, triggers and stored procedures participate in the analysis and resolution of issues related to information content, data integrity, integration, and performance conduct proactive database monitoring to identify performance improvement opportunities work as part of a development team; create structured code for integration into larger systems, as well as documentation for ongoing maintenance in production environments work closely with data architects, project managers, quality assurance analysts and business intelligence consultants conduct research and make recommendations on database products, services, protocols, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts qualifications/skills: computer science or engineering degree with at least 5 years of relevant experience proficiency with ms sql server, sql server development, & t-sql etl expertise using ms sql server 2008 ssis or later data warehousing experience, including an understanding of fundamental concepts, schemas, and dimensional snowflake models understanding of major rdbms; including ms sql, oracle, & access knowledge and experience with both waterfall/sdlc and agile development methodologies past involvement with architectural systems design (client/server, distributed multi-tier) experience developing and administrating sharepoint 2013 experience with sql server analysis services (ssas), and microsoft sql server data tools 2012 qualifications & skills – preferred: experience in a healthcare environment exposure to formalized data governance, data quality processes and master data management processes privacy and security concepts exposure to business intelligence (bi) tools prior experience leading bi and dw projects within a healthcare environment is considered a strong asset. in addition to the above technical skills, all candidates for the above roles shall possess: excellent oral and written communication skills analytical abilities and ability to work effectively with technical & business users ability to understand business requirements and convert them to functional specifications ability to create technical and functional documentation ability to work effectively with all levels of management qualified candidates are invited to submit their resumes and cover letters, in one document, quoting file 171165 to: human resources sunnybrook health sciences centre to apply, please click "apply for position" near the top right corner of this page sunnybrook health sciences centre is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda). if you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter. sunnybrook health sciences centre is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants print inshare0 business intelligence analyst information technology cooke aquaculture saint john, new brunswick cooke aquaculture inc., a dynamic and growing east coast family company, with platinum member status in the canada’s best managed companies program, is offering a unique opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join the it team as business intelligence analyst in saint john, new brunswick. founded in 1985, cooke aquaculture inc. has grown from a small family business to the world’s largest independent, fully-integrated producer of atlantic salmon and related products. the company remains family owned and based in blacks harbour, nb, with operations throughout atlantic canada, us, chile, spain and scotland.  cooke aquaculture is committed to responsible and sustainable seafood production and the delivery of high quality products through a number of brands and sales offices throughout canada, the us and internationally. the company is also a proud partner and supporter of a variety of community-based organizations and events. reporting to the business intelligence manager, the business intelligence analyst will work with the business intelligence team to develop and provide new business intelligence solutions.  working with the business intelligence manager and other internal stakeholders, you will define, and develop existing or new structures around data capture and reporting, data centric reports utilizing data visualization best practices to empower the organization to make key business and operational decision.  you will have responsibility for creation and validation of a full suite of operational reports, dashboards, and analytics.  you will bring your experience in acquiring, curating, linking, integrating and interconverting data from a wide variety of sources.  you have a strong knowledge of microsoft sql, ssis, ssrs, ssas, power bi, visual studio, azure and all spreadsheet tools.  additionally you have a broad understanding of multiple technologies, including dbms, etl, edw creation reporting, olap and other bi related technologies. along with your high level of technical skills, you also bring the ability to work in a fast-paced environment on multiple projects, for the creation of technical solutions to meet organization’s business requirements.  while you will be working within a team environment, the ability to work independently is key to your success. this is an exciting opportunity to work in a company that is positioned for continued growth both regionally and globally. please forward your resume to date posted: 
oct 4, 2017
                                

 reference code: 25841-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: vaughan, ontario, canada 
all available locations: markham; mississauga; toronto; vaughan 
external posting descriptionour cyber intelligence practice is currently seeking a level 1 analyst who is self-motivated, energetic, driven for success and results-oriented. the analyst will provide first level technical support services in our 24x7x365 days cyber intelligence centre (cic). analyst will also be a key player in building world-class security operations centre that is aligned with our strategic direction and that helps the firm better deliver on new and existing engagements.
 
responsibilities:

review security-related events, assessing risk ad validity, and reporting of findings
analyze network traffic to assist in testing new signatures for production deployment to client environments
investigate incidents using a logrhythm, arcsight, qradar
advanced understanding of business processes, internal control risk management, it controls and related standards
facilitate use of technology-based tools or methodologies to review, design and/or implement products and services
work closely with your team to exceed our client’s expectation while identifying and mitigating business risks associated with projects
cyber security analyst to provide first level technical support services in our 24x7x365 days cyber intelligence centre (cic)

 
incident response and investigation:

log collection, incident and threat detection
evidence collection, and threat and risk management
incident management methodologies
review security-related events, assessing severity, criticality and priority
monitor and report based on client slas with an emphasis on quality and accuracy

 
external posting qualifications
bachelor’s degree or diploma in information security or networking capacity
minimum of one year experience within a security operation centre
good work knowledge of:
	
server platforms (unix, windows, etc.)
networking
security (firewall, ids/ips, proxy systems, etc.)
vulnerability assessment
linux system configuration



 
additional assets:

working toward or already have industry certification (cissp/giac)
direct prior experience with either arcsight, qradar, logrhythm
network architecture
bilingual with spanish or french

 
 
 
get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
 
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
 
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Team Lead, Business Intelligence Analyst
text:
team lead, business intelligence analyst - paradigm quest - job board view our website view all jobs paradigm quest thanks for visiting our job board. please review our open positions and apply to the positions that match your qualifications. team lead, business intelligence analyst toronto, ontario (on), canada full time manager/supervisor   team lead, business intelligence analyst: challenging, impactful, rewarding who we are: paradigm is an innovative, flexible, leading-edge business process outsourcing (bpo) company. as canada’s leading mortgage outsourcing company, paradigm’s mandate is to enable new and existing lenders with a cost effective mortgage operation solution that can quickly respond to market conditions, lead the market in innovation and ultimately provide mortgage consumers with great choice, vastly improving their mortgage experience. paradigm culture: paradigm is committed to open and honest communication with our staff.  we believe by being transparent, truthful and sincere, we can serve each other and our clients with integrity. our culture can be summed up in one word: family.  we work hard at creating an exceptional professional family here at paradigm and do not take it for granted.  every initiative, new hire, company event and daily activities are focused on maintaining and fostering our paradigm family because we know that our employees are undoubtedly the key to our success. the opportunity: as a member of our it team, you will be responsible for analysis, development, implementation and support of technical solutions that satisfy reporting and analytical needs of the business.  all while providing a focus on innovating technology to dramatically improve the customer experience. role specific accountabilities include, but are not limited to the following:  development of integrated business intelligence solutions within a complex and fast-paced environment, using technologies listed below work with key business leaders to determine our business intelligence strategic roadmap by providing thought leadership and vision identify, and manage, to successful conclusion initiatives and projects that will enable our business intelligence strategic roadmap interact with business analysts and business clients, diagnosing/analyzing business issues to develop an understanding of requirements for reporting or performance management solutions regularly identifies usability problems and make suggestions for improvement acts as a resource to other departments on products and applications reviews, evaluates and updates product development documentation identifies and enforces standards and best practices   educational /technical experience: bachelor's degree in computer science/computer engineering or equivalent minimum 5 years of ms sql server experience creating/modifying views, stored procedures, and functions minimum 5 years of ms ssrs experience creating report definitions minimum 5 years of ms ssis experience developing etl workflows 2+ years of financial services / mortgage experience powerbi & sharepoint development is a definite asset   personal requirements: exhibits solid communication skills, both written and verbal with ability to communicate and articulate technical information into layman terms strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities initiative and organizational skills strong results orientation able to adapt and quickly develop in-depth technical understanding of new/different applications strong ability to analyze situations, diagnose problems, develop and implement solutions, often within narrow time frames. should be a team player willing to work on a variety of technical initiatives should have the ability to work independently and identify priorities for completion of multiple tasks / projects under pressure. ability to prioritize and follow-up on work excellent organizational skills and analytical skills detail oriented sense of humour title: Intermediate Data Integration Specialist
text:
intermediate data integration specialist (etl)










 
back to job listings help 





intermediate data integration specialist (etl)






company description
porter airlines has revolutionized short-haul flying with a warm and effortless approach to hospitality, restoring glamour and refinement to air travel. porter escapes provides a carefully curated menu of flights exclusive to porter airlines, hotels and unique leisure options to plan the perfect holiday.

flights and packages are available to toronto, ottawa, montreal, quebec city, moncton, halifax, st. john’s, thunder bay, sault ste. marie, sudbury, timmins, north bay, windsor, new york (newark), chicago (midway), boston, washington (dulles), pittsburgh and with seasonal flights to mt. tremblant, que., myrtle beach, s.c., burlington, vt., and orlando-melbourne, fla.



job details

function: 

do you like collecting and transforming billions of records of data from systems and applications?  have you built data integration processes to support business intelligence & analytical applications? this position will play a key contributor and promoter of developing and expanding the use of data across porter. to better serve our customers and our operations. all while enjoying the perks of working at one of the best airlines in canada. 

duties and responsibilities:

develop and maintain etl and data integration processes between internal and external systems
expand and enhance the data areas in the data warehouse
responsible for analyzing and improving data quality and integrity in the data warehouse
work with business groups to define and document requirements for data projects
provide guidance and assistance to business and technology groups on their data needs
maintain and support multiple projects, working with the technology teams, project managers, business groups
document data processes for corporate initiatives and projects
provide support for data processes after hours and weekends, when needed
actively participate in porter safety management system(sms) including reporting hazards and incidents encountered in daily operations; understand, comply and promote the company safety policy
any other duties as requested by the director

behavioural competencies: 

concern for safety - identifying hazardous or potentially hazardous situations and taking appropriate action to maintain a safe environment for self and others. 
teamwork - working collaboratively with others to achieve organizational goals.  
customer service - providing service excellence to internal and/or external customers (passengers). 
initiative - dealing with situations and issues proactively and persistently, seizing opportunities that arise. 
results focused - focusing efforts on achieving high-quality results consistent with the organization’s standards. 
fostering communication - listening and communicating openly, honestly, and respectfully with different audiences, promoting dialogue and building consensus. 
  
qualifications: 


post-secondary degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering or similar degree preferred
excellent knowledge of database design, data warehouse methodologies, and data techniques
minimum of 5 years of experience developing data integration/etl solutions
minimum of 5 years of experience designing and developing big data and data warehouse solutions
exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
excellent sql experience with multiple  database systems including sql server, mysql,  redshift or similar
excellent written and verbal communication skills, to communicate with business stakeholders, project teams and project managers
experience with various sdlc methodologies and requirements gathering
experience in the travel or airline industry is an asset

  
technical skills:


5 + years of experience developing and maintaining data integration (etl) processes using tools such as microsoft ssis, pentaho, or matillion
3 + years of experience using open source programming languages such as python or java
experience using google sheets
experience with amazon web services (aws) products and services, especially redshift, kinesis, lambda, emr, or rds experience

all available locations: montreal 
external posting descriptionour analytic team is seeking a consultant who is passionate about using technology, leveraging analytic models and approaches to solve business problems. ideally you will be someone who displays initiative, lateral thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving. your main responsibility would be to position the analytic practice with sas.  support the expansion of the analytic practice in quebec working on analytics and digital strategic advisory mandates and implementation projects
 
in particular you will be involved in :

work in a fast growing, problem solving, innovative, agile and technology enabled environment with like­minded people who are eminent in their respective fields such as analytics strategy, business intelligence, data modeling, agile bi delivery, data management, big data, data visualization, data science and much more
orienting, designing and implementing business intelligence and data warehousing solutions problem solving critical client issues using data to deliver valued results
balancing multiple client projects and other responsibilities
becoming a reference in analytics and information management, particularly in the financial services industry and in the marketing/customer oriented lines of business
participate in building the practice, growing the team and developing eminence communicating effectively to all levels of management

external posting qualifications
1 to 3 years in a business area such as finance, risk/insurance 3 years+ in design analytics and data architectures
highly proficient in sql (or a variant such as t­sql or plsql) programming 3 years+ in implementing sas technology
experienced in other sas solutions including base sas, enterprise miner, visual analytics and other sas technologies would be well regarded
strong understanding of the sas intelligence platform and integration with applications, databases, and service oriented architectures (soap, json, rest)
the capability of quickly, regularly, and independently learning new technologies under the pressure of consistent high­profile project deliverables with review by peers and analytic leaders
strong commitment to professional and client service excellence

get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: SAP Business Intelligence Developer
text:
imax careers

homeabout us








 


your user session will timeout in 5 minutes.  please click ok to continue with your application.

















					sap business intelligence developer
				


						tracking code
					

						485-082 
					

						job description
					

what we’re about
 
imax is not your everyday entertainment experience, so it’s not surprising that imax employees and their careers go beyond the ordinary. our employees share a passion for quality in everything they do. our hollywood people are movie business insiders with years of production experience. our technology experts are unashamedly geeky – people who can talk for hours, and be riveting, about color gamut and lasers. our business people are consummate sales and marketing professionals who are spreading the imax word around the world.
 
of course we offer all the benefits you’d expect from a company with over 40 years of history. yet, beyond this, we know everyone works differently and is motivated by different things. that’s why we offer competitive pay and a wide assortment of benefits – to help you make the most of your life at work and away from it.
 
as the world’s leading entertainment technology company, imax has revolutionized the way people experience movies. specializing in immersive motion picture technologies, our employees are driven by a passion to take audiences around the world to places they’ve only dreamed of.
 
come explore imax – where innovation, creativity and passion come together.


						required skills
					

this position will be responsible for design & development of business intelligence solutions, reports and provide ongoing support.
 
this position will be responsible for working with bi manager and our information systems staff and business systems users. imax recently completed the initial sap implementation for imax corporate functions, subsequent roll-outs are planned as well as continuous improvement initiatives. given our global growth, demonstrated ability to prioritized and work as a team is critical.
 
what you’ll be doing:
 

lead 2-3 end-to-end business intelligence solutions and manage bi projects
lead 2-3 end-to-end bi integrated planning solutions and manage bi ip projects
gather business requirements and analyze the available sap delivered business content and identify the gaps that exist with respect to the project requirements
work with the functional team to develop the reporting requirements
develop a data model design for bi, etl (export, transform and load) and indexing design specification
development and modifications to datasources, infoproviders & the process chains
development and modifications to custom abap extractors
experienced in bi-ip (integrated planning) tool – development of real time info cubes, multiproviders, aggregation levels, filters, planning functions, planning sequences input ready queries and variables
development and modifications to the planning functions, planning sequence and other ip functionalities
good at writing fox functions and abap user-exits - good abap knowledge desired
ability to build process chains for any ip planning functions / sequences / data loads
development of queries in bex, workbooks
expertise in bi performance tuning: performed tuning measures of queries by maintaining aggregates, roll up, compression, partition, process chains, indexing of info cubes and use of statistics for the same. also, used variety of techniques to boost the performance of bex query
familiar with bi ip best practices and standards
ability to work well independently and as an effective team member
effectively provide ongoing support - investigate, troubleshoot, and resolve in a timely manner
manage multiple assignments, aggressive targets and critical deadlines
provide unit testing, integration testing, and participate in qa/qc process
participate in project life cycle activities as required
provide on-call and after hours support as required
experienced working with both onshore and offshore environment
other activities as assigned

 
 
what we’re looking for:
 

5+ years of experience in implementing & supporting sap bi projects
2-3 years of experience in implementing & supporting sap bi integrated planning projects
data extraction using standard and enhanced data extractors and available development tools for sap and non-sap data sources
experience in sap abap and oops abap
experience in developing custom extractions to bi
experience with bobj considered an asset
experience with: apis, bapis, user exits
strong understanding of reporting concepts, data loading process and procedures
experience with sap ecc finance and supply chain interaction an asset
sap erp data structure knowledge
experience with interaction with sap/business objects bpc considered an asset
experience in netweaver bi 7.0 or above preferred
demonstrated ability in project management accountabilities, leading projects and team-building
must have outstanding analytical and problem solving skills and a good grasp of both the technical and business side of business intelligence. they must always keep up to date with the latest bi tools and technologies
university or technical degree in computer science or equivalent
proven strength in analytical and process thinking skills                      
excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively oral and written



						required experience
					

please apply online. we thank all applicants for their interest in imax but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
imax is an equal opportunity employer.

city on - torontoqc - montreal    job description   achieve your full potential in an environment where there’s flexibility to cultivate your personal brand and knowledge base. pwc canada helps organizations and individuals create the value they’re looking for. more than 5,700 partners and staff in offices across the country are committed to delivering quality in assurance, tax, consulting and deals services. pwc canada is a member of the pwc network of firms with more than 180,000 people in 158 countries. consulting & deals: in our consulting & deals (c&d) practice, you’ll work with people who have a broad range of skills and expertise. it’s a great way to learn on the job and build on a variety of business skills that will serve you throughout your career. you’ll work with people who have deep subject matter expertise across a variety of industries, including: financial services; retail; technology and communications; mining and energy; as well as within the public sector. working with our professional’s means you’ll get the coaching and training you need to develop your career. analytics practice:pwc’s expanded data & analytics practice will be growing their presence throughout 2017 and 2018 in several key areas. we are looking to appoint our future leaders… people with an outstanding track record of delivering impactful results… people who have the vision and foresight to take their career to the next level and be part of a winning, collaborative team.  do you specialize within the big data/data science/artificial intelligence/behavioural economics space?  are you looking for an opportunity to further leverage your attributes and consulting experience while developing new skills at a ferocious pace? if this is the case then take a look at the below opportunities below that will be hiring in 2017 and into 2018.  job title: consulting data scientist our data scientists are client facing with an ability to understand complex business problems, and how to solve those problems by leveraging analytics applied on client and 3rd party data. the data scientist’s job is to also make the solution “real”, by integrating it into business processes. finding in those process points for automation of decisions and process through artificial intelligence.  the core consulting actions this role helps drive include:collaborating and contributing as a team member: understanding personal and team roles; contributing to a positive working environment by building solid relationships with team members; proactively seeking guidance, clarification and feedback. identifying and addressing client needs: building solid relationships with clients; approaching clients in an organized manner; delivering clear requests for information; demonstrating flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks; communicating potential conflicts to a senior team member. prioritizing and handling multiple tasks; researching and analyzing pertinent client, industry, and technical matters; utilizing problem-solving skills; and, communicating effectively in written and verbal formats to various audiences (including various levels of management and external clients) in a professional business environment. coaching and collaborating with peers who assist with this work, including providing coaching, feedback and guidance on work performance. ability to help others think critically and share complex technical solutions to non-technical audiences both orally and in writing; proven strong consensus building abilities; proven skills to work effectively across internal functional areas in ambiguous situations. the core data science and research action this role drives include: understanding client data in the context of a client engagement objective (e.g. find process efficiency, increase marketing effectiveness, predict operational volume, automation manual processes and decision points)  designing solution leveraging cloud and existing enterprise architecture (e.g. leverage google, microsoft, and other major cloud capabilities) within the constraints of client architecture  internal research to drive intellectual property in key areas of focus for the analytics organization  collaborate with our major partnerships (i.e .with ai research centres across canada) on research and client problem solving  technical leadership on key analytic platforms on google and microsoft  collaborate with cross-functional internal and client teams  requirements:  ph.d. or ms in computer science, electrical engineering, statistics, applied math or related topics with at least 2 years of research or work experience in ai and automation strong background in machine learning (deep learning), ai and neural network concepts, and solid foundation of statistics theory experience in sql, relational databases, database concepts, dimensional modelling and database design python, r, and other scripting language expertise knowledge of key cloud platforms including google cloud platform and microsoft azure bilingual is a key asset why work for pwc be part of a dynamic, inclusive workplace environment, where you are valued for the unique contribution you bring. pwc is the world's largest professional services firm and is continuing to expand and move up in the industry. pwc is upping the game significantly in the consulting space. we have grown from 110k+ to 180+k people in the last 9 years. we have acquired some very high profile organizations as part of this growth, including strategy firms such as prtm, diamond, biond and now booz & co. we have also made a number of canadian acquisitions and continue to look for other additions to complement our business. pwc is rapidly expanding its data & analytics (d&a) practice with the expectation to more than double the practice in the next 2 years. im is considered among the five strategic big bets for the firm. this is an exciting place to be with innovative ideas, business models and career advancement opportunities. pwc approaches d&a from a business perspective. if you have been looking for an opportunity to expand from a technical base to become a more versatile management consultant, this is a golden opportunity. our d&a business is focused on information strategy / governance and bi / analytics, in particular. pwc invests in its people. we are fostering a learning culture that allows people to learn new skills and try different projects, while balancing the economics and constraints of the environments we do business in. take advantage of our comprehensive benefits, including our fitness allowance and wellness programs, which help you find better flexibility with work and other parts of your life. pwc is socially responsible. we have a csr office and a large foundation that invests in our community. we offer grant programs based on staff (volunteering) contributions to the community as well as education programs for board members of charities. pwc is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve.  we encourage qualified candidates, including aboriginals and persons with disabilities, to apply.  pwc: the opportunity of a lifetime     apply to job   save to cart   view similar jobs

are you the one?
here at blakely, we’re looking for someone who loves pouring through facts and figures to find meaningful nuggets and then sharing these discoveries with the team and clients. if this is the job that you’ve been waiting for, blakely inc. has an opening for a business intelligence professional with:

strong ability to extract, transform and analyze data in a variety of formats from both client and internal sources
experience working with analysis and visualization software (r preferred)
skilled in visual storytelling through clear concise reports, dashboards and presentations
ability to translate requests from, and communicate findings to, non-technical end-users
background in analysis for marketing or fundraising (ideally in an agency environment)

if, in addition to your experience, you are a collaborative team player, problem solver, extremely well organized and detail-oriented – then we want you at blakely.
your remuneration package will be tailored to fit your experience and skills.
if this sounds like you and you are ready for change, please send your resume to info@blakelyjourney.com
we thank all who are interested, however only candidates of interest will be contacted.

who you are:

you have sound judgement, keen eye for details and tenacity for solving difficult problems.
strong analytical skills and use of data for sound decision-making.
you bring a positive energy to the team and thrive on strong collaboration.
you strive for constant improvement in both yourself and your team in meaningful ways.
you are someone others look to for solving difficult problems, bounce ideas off and providing an alternate viewpoint.
on your precima adventure, you will be involved in:

creating and designing innovative cutting-edge customer-centric reporting solutions
using qlikview, create dynamic dashboards, scorecards and design user interfaces
data modeling to ensure accuracy and efficiency of data relationships within reports 
participating in creating, maintaining and updating customized training materials for client users.
working with a wide variety of teams, from client services to data scientists, to enable our clientsto execute their strategic retail plans
participating in business reviews to ensure understanding of retail business processes and products, data extraction 
providing a consultative approach in delivering relevant ideas, solutions and results to clients and business partners via bi tools 
integrating with retail client teams to operationalize existing and future processes for retail clients 
work to build, automate and implement robust reporting methodologies that enable more profitable product, pricing and promotion decisions in support of partner customer strategies 
project coordination and administrative activities
 
we are looking for you to bring to the team:

a desire to learn and grow
sound agile development practices (code reviews, testing, etc.)
open mind to new ideas and delivery
basic to intermediate understanding of web standards
   skills you need for the job:

having or enrolled in a bachelor degree in any of the following areas: engineering, computer science, math or other related discipline.
bi experience
knowledge of sql and database principles
understanding of basic ui principles
excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
excellent ability to be part of multiple projects/initiatives of varying size and complexity, while simultaneously meeting deadlines in a diverse environment
proven ability to be creative in managing client relationship
self-motivated with the ability to work independently or as part of a team
enthusiasm and experience working in an agile team environment
highly desired:

experience with analytics and/or big data
understanding of retail strategy
benefits at loyaltyone:

high impact role with interesting challenges
flexible hours and strong work life balance
free starbucks coffee and lattes
subsidized catered bistro café
on-site gym and massage therapy
great health and wellness benefits
located directly above st. patrick subway station
 
about precima

precima, housed within loyaltyone, is a retail strategy and analytics company that provides tailored, data-driven solutions to drive sales, boost profitability, and build customer loyalty. leveraging deep analytics expertise, precima helps organizations improve their competitive position across all facets of planning and operations from pricing optimization, promotional planning, assortment optimization, targeted marketing, and supplier collaboration. in 2016 the company was named among the top 10 analytics solution providers by retail cio outlook.precima's roster of past and current clients includes many leading fortune 1000 brands, among them some of the top high-frequency retailers in north america. backed by firsthand experience with leading retail and manufacturing organizations, the precima team brings a remarkable blend of expertise in loyalty, analytics, marketing and management to help you make more informed and profitable business decisions.

this role is within the precima team
this position is located in toronto
alliance data is an equal employment opportunity employer. accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.
alliance data participates in e-verify

member status in the canada’s best managed companies program, is offering a unique opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join the it team as business intelligence analyst in saint john, new brunswick. founded in 1985, cooke aquaculture inc. has grown from a small family business to the world’s largest independent, fully-integrated producer of atlantic salmon and related products. the company remains family owned and based in blacks harbour, nb, with operations throughout atlantic canada, us, chile, spain and scotland.  cooke aquaculture is committed to responsible and sustainable seafood production and the delivery of high quality products through a number of brands and sales offices throughout canada, the us and internationally. the company is also a proud partner and supporter of a variety of community-based organizations and events. reporting to the business intelligence manager, the business intelligence analyst will work with the business intelligence team to data capture and reporting, data centric reports utilizing data visualization best practices to empower the organization to make key business and operational decision.  you will have responsibility oct 4, 2017
                                

 reference code: 25841-en_us


job type:  permanent 
primary location: vaughan, ontario, canada 
all available locations: markham; mississauga; toronto; vaughan 
external posting descriptionour cyber intelligence practice is currently seeking a level 1 analyst who is self-motivated, energetic, driven for success and results-oriented. the analyst will provide first level technical support services in our 24x7x365 days cyber intelligence centre (cic). analyst will also be a key player in building world-class security operations centre that is aligned with our strategic direction and that helps the firm better deliver on new and existing engagements.
 
responsibilities:

review security-related events, assessing risk ad validity, and reporting of findings
analyze network traffic to assist in testing new signatures for production deployment to client environments
investigate incidents using a logrhythm, arcsight, qradar
advanced understanding of business processes, internal control risk management, it controls and related standards
facilitate use of technology-based tools or methodologies to review, design and/or implement products and services
work closely with your team to exceed our client’s expectation while identifying and mitigating business risks associated with projects
cyber security analyst to provide first level technical support services in our 24x7x365 days cyber intelligence centre (cic)

 
incident response and investigation:

log collection, incident and threat detection
evidence collection, and threat and risk management
incident management methodologies
review security-related events, assessing severity, criticality and priority
monitor and report based on client slas with an emphasis on quality and accuracy

 
external posting qualifications
bachelor’s degree or diploma in information security or networking capacity
minimum of one year experience within a security operation centre
good work knowledge of:
	
server platforms (unix, windows, etc.)
networking
security (firewall, ids/ips, proxy systems, etc.)
vulnerability assessment
linux system configuration



 
additional assets:

working toward or already have industry certification (cissp/giac)
direct prior experience with either arcsight, qradar, logrhythm
network architecture
bilingual with spanish or french

 
 
 
get your career off to a great start. what impact will you make?
we’re always looking for people with the relentless energy to drive and push themselves further to find new avenues and unique ways of reaching our shared goals. at deloitte, we know that being the undisputed leader means empowering our people to be the very best they can be – so they can make an impact that matters for clients, colleagues and the community, and for their own careers.
 
we offer a truly differentiated talent experience that empowers our people with unlimited opportunities to do meaningful work and to grow, learn, and lead at every point in their career.  deloitte’s newly designed offices offer unique workspaces that strengthen connections, inspire innovative ways of working, and provide the necessary tools to help you make an impact that matters. and with our global reach and network, you’ll always be part of the deloitte community.
“once deloitte, always deloitte.”
 
lead yourself. lead a team. lead the firm. it’s all possible at deloitte.
deloitte is one of canada’s leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across canada. at deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today’s local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today’s and tomorrow’s challenges. 
 
let deloitte show you how to push your career to the next level. and let your story unfold.
deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce.  we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. please advise the recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.  information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
we thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

cib - global corporate banking - senior analyst/associate

req #: 170096429
location:


toronto, 
		on,
                ca

job category: investment banking
potential referral amount: 0 us dollar (usd)

the global corporate bank manages j.p. morgan's overall
relationships with large corporations and public sector organizations globally
to solve problems for clients and help them to grow. we help our clients meet
their objectives and challenges in financing, risk management, working capital,
cash management and investments. clients benefit from dedicated coverage
provided by experienced corporate bankers, who deliver the firm's extensive
product platform and presence in more than 60 countries worldwide. we leverage
the capital strength of jpmorgan chase and extend credit to help clients grow
their business. 

as a central part of the firm's plans to further expand its successful
international banking franchise, the global corporate bank offers exciting
opportunities as a place to work. 

we are currently seeking to recruit for a global corporate banking analyst or
associate to support our team. 

role description: 

working in a team environment, the analyst/associate will have access to senior
officers of the firm and senior clients. you will be challenged to perform at
the highest levels of excellence and are rewarded for your achievements in a
demanding environment. the analyst would be required to work with other
professionals as a team drawing from the full spectrum of the firm's resources
to develop customized financial solutions to meet the needs of clients. 

the analyst/associate will work with managing directors, executive directors,
vice presidents and associates, assisting them with all client activities
(marketing, execution and on-going relationship management). the
analyst/associate will assume responsibility for managing internal processes
for deal executions, internal approvals, business aspects of regulatory
reporting and ongoing management of client relationship 

core responsibilities: 
• assisting corporate bankers in managing existing client relationship and
developing new client base 
• preparing internal approval documents such as credit memos and balance sheet
committee models. 
• help with industry and credit analysis (review financial statements, listen
to and summarize investor presentations, and support credit approval and
documentation process) 
• conduct industry and company research 
• maintain internal reports including deal tracking, pipeline reports, and
balance sheet memos 
• assist in the preparation of pitch books and other marketing materials to
help generate new revenue 
• help with projects as requested
qualifications 
• bachelor's degree with outstanding academic credentials 
• high level of motivation, dependability, intelligence & a team player 
• at least 2 years of professional work experience (corporate banking,
investment banking or credit experience ideal)
• excellent ms office skills, specifically excel based modelling and powerpoint

• excellent verbal and written communication skills 
• strong quantitative, analytical and computer skills including powerpoint and
excel based modelling 
• familiarity with jp morgan processes and products 
• proficiency with research tools including bloomberg

title: Team Lead, Business Intelligence Analyst
text:
team lead, business intelligence analyst - paradigm quest - job board view our website view all jobs paradigm quest thanks for visiting our job board. please review our open positions and apply to the positions that match your qualifications. team lead, business intelligence analyst toronto, ontario (on), canada full time manager/supervisor   team lead, business intelligence analyst: challenging, impactful, rewarding who we are: paradigm is an innovative, flexible, leading-edge business process outsourcing (bpo) company. as canada’s leading mortgage outsourcing company, paradigm’s mandate is to enable new and existing lenders with a cost effective mortgage operation solution that can quickly respond to market conditions, lead the market in innovation and ultimately provide mortgage consumers with great choice, vastly improving their mortgage experience. paradigm culture: paradigm is committed to open and honest communication with our staff.  we believe by being transparent, truthful and sincere, we can serve each other and our clients with integrity. our culture can be summed up in one word: family.  we work hard at creating an exceptional professional family here at paradigm and do not take it for granted.  every initiative, new hire, company event and daily activities are focused on maintaining and fostering our paradigm family because we know that our employees are undoubtedly the key to our success. the opportunity: as a member of our it team, you will be responsible for analysis, development, implementation and support of technical solutions that satisfy reporting and analytical needs of the business.  all while providing a focus on innovating technology to dramatically improve the customer experience. role specific accountabilities include, but are not limited to the following:  development of integrated business intelligence solutions within a complex and fast-paced environment, using technologies listed below work with key business leaders to determine our business intelligence strategic roadmap by providing thought leadership and vision identify, and manage, to successful conclusion initiatives and projects that will enable our business intelligence strategic roadmap interact with business analysts and business clients, diagnosing/analyzing business issues to develop an understanding of requirements for reporting or performance management solutions regularly identifies usability problems and make suggestions for improvement acts as a resource to other departments on products and applications reviews, evaluates and updates product development documentation identifies and enforces standards and best practices   educational /technical experience: bachelor's degree in computer science/computer engineering or equivalent minimum 5 years of ms sql server experience creating/modifying views, stored procedures, and functions minimum 5 years of ms ssrs experience creating report definitions minimum 5 years of ms ssis experience developing etl workflows 2+ years of financial services / mortgage experience powerbi & sharepoint development is a definite asset   personal requirements: exhibits solid communication skills, both written and verbal with ability to communicate and articulate technical information into layman terms strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities initiative and organizational skills strong results orientation able to adapt and quickly develop in-depth technical understanding of new/different applications strong ability to analyze situations, diagnose problems, develop and implement solutions, often within narrow time frames. should be a team player willing to work on a variety of technical initiatives should have the ability to work independently and identify priorities for completion of multiple tasks / projects under pressure. ability to prioritize and follow-up on work excellent organizational skills and analytical skills detail oriented sense of humour
